official-title.#text: To provide for a Medicare demonstration project to evaluate the fiscal impact of covering low vision devices as durable medical equipment under part B of the Medicare program.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

sponsor.#text: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Medicare Demonstration of Coverage for Low Vision Devices Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Demonstration of Medicare coverage of low vision devices as durable medical equipment

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (in this section referred to as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of Health and Human Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: in the same or similar manner as coverage is provided for durable medical equipment under such part.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: part B of title XVIII of the Social Security Act

quote.#tail: ) shall commence a project (in this section referred to as the
) to demonstrate and evaluate the impact of covering low vision devices (including subsets of such devices) under

text.#text: Beginning not later than 1 year after the date of the enactment of this Act, the

term.#tail: means a device, prescribed by a physician, that magnifies, enhances, or otherwise augments or interprets visual images irrespective of the size, form, or technological features of such device and does not include ordinary eyeglasses or contact lenses or a device that is otherwise available for non-prescription retail sale to the general public at a cost of less than $500. In the previous sentence, the term
means lenses that are intended to fully correct visual acuity or eliminate refractive error.

text.#text: An individual enrolled under such part is eligible to participate in the demonstration project if an ophthalmologist or optometrist, after a clinical evaluation, has determined and certifies through a prescription that furnishing a low vision device to the individual is medically necessary.
The demonstration project shall be national in scope and shall be conducted for a period of 5 years.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall design the demonstration project in a manner so as to provide a rich, well-structured, and defined data set from which inferences about the impact of the project can be made using appropriate statistical methods.
shall consult with organizations of consumers with vision loss and other stakeholder organizations.

text.#text: In conducting the demonstration project the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committee on Finance of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report that describes the progress and preliminary findings from the demonstration project.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Energy and Commerce of the House of Representatives

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the last day of the third year of the demonstration project, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall submit to such Committees a final report on the project. Such report shall include an evaluation of the fiscal impact on the Medicare program of providing coverage of low vision devices and such other findings and recommendations as the

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the last day of the demonstration project and after solicitation and consideration of formal written input on the project from organizations representing consumers with vision loss and other stakeholder organizations, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: For fiscal year 2014 and for each of the four succeeding fiscal years, out of any funds in the Treasury not otherwise appropriated,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: to carry out the demonstration project
